annotation.TEXT: Squish!
Alright, I got my line piece in time! Well, I guess I'll clear the level now.
Man, I still wish there was a "next piece" display... Maybe they could've made it so that Lakitu holds the next piece over his head while you're working with the current one.
Also, falling in a pit will cut his lifespan short too, and being pushed against the left edge of the screen by blocks due to the autoscroll often has deadly consequences as well.
Oh, nice. We're back to solid ground... Well, when I jump down there, that is.
Well, I guess I'll have to build the castle myself, with Tetris pieces! I get two minutes to do this, so let's get cracking!
Hello, and welcome to Tuper Tario Tros.! Let's get this game started here!
Switch between games? Okay, let's try it!
CAUTION: Loud sound effect coming in a few seconds!

Oh, and just like in SMB, you'll want to hit the top of the flag for 5000 points. Fortunately, Tetris pieces make that an easy feat! (Also, no, you can't jump over the flagpole without hitting it. You'll just magically grab it anyway and get the usual 5000 points.)
I kind of want to place this piece so that Mario can hit all the ? blocks in it...
Huh, I wonder how my score compares to the leaders...

Unfortunately, you don't get any kind of combo bonus for killing multiple Goombas at once like that, nor do you get any special points for having Mario stomp a bunch of them in one jump (but if you could, combo points would be kind of abusable).
SQUISH!!!
Too bad I can't duck here. Hmm...
Uh, I don't know why the pause screen popped up there, but whatever.
So, jump to hit blocks and squash Goombas, yada, yada... Also, a noble mushroom embiggens the smallest Mario, like usual.
Oh, yeah, and I gotta get some coins.
Ha! I get to think outside the box while constructing Tetrises in this game!
Huh?
Jackpot! 15K is nothing to sneeze at, so shoot for that perfect castle if you can!

If Mario does die, you get sent back to a previous checkpoint (there are several, and they're not marked). In addition, your scores will revert to whatever they were at that checkpoint. Losing all your lives ends the game (duh), and costs you all of your progress.

Oh, nice. Sometimes, random bricks in the tetrominos you place will turn out to be multi-coin blocks, which hold 5 coins. However, beware, as this can sometimes screw you over, like if you were expecting to break a brick to get through a passage.
Uh, oh. That pipe is spawning Goombas. However, Tetris pieces can be used as weapons against them!

However, the game is kind of inconsistent about that last form of death. There's a possibility that Mario will survive autoscroll squishing if he's super, and break some of the blocks that tried to flatten him, but don't rely heavily on that happening!
Smack! Problem solved! And I know the next ? block I hit will definitely be a mushroom!

And, unless you get exceedingly lucky, you'll probably have to discard some tetrominos that way towards the end of the castle-building in order to get that bonus. Hopefully time won't run out before you get the pieces you need!

Hey, my mushroom despawned! I didn't know it could do that. But, thinking about it, that kind of makes sense gameplay wise, because what if a mushroom ended up in a sealed-off location that you couldn't get to?
It's a shame that there's no "next piece" display of some sort, though...
I don't think I'm getting into the lower area that way...
Yay, clobbering Mario for fun and profit!
Come on, J piece!
Just be sure not to clobber Mario while he's small (or let a Goomba get to him in that state), or else he'll die, which you kind of don't want to happen.
Now, you only have to fill the outer edges of the castle to win, and any bricks that fall outside of the outline will become faded out and won't impede other falling pieces.
I want to guarantee that 5000 points... Also, don't worry about the Tetris blocks clogging up the flag. They'll fade when you hit it.
Yeah, I'm sure most (if not all) of you guys are all too familiar with this opening setup...
Additionally, if you don't feel like inflicting pain on Mario, this row of bricks is fairly easy to clear part of with Tetris pieces.
Ooh, it's the end-of-level flag! Well, the autoscroll will force me to hit it eventually, but I should be able to complete some lines first.
Whoa, that was a glitch... That piece shouldn't have sunk into the ground like that.
Well, I'm getting fairly lucky with the piece distribution so far...
There's no way to proceed without playing some Tetris here, that's for sure.

Oww... Hey, watch where you're placing that! If a falling tetromino hits Mario, he gets hurt. However, you can always regrow him with another mushroom, which'll likely be in the next ? block you open.
Uh, gotta pitch this squiggly one...
If I can clear enough lines here, I can open a path for Mario to get into the room below. (This kind of reminds me of Tetris Plus now.)
May as well squash some Goombas with my discard fodder if they're nearby.
If you want the full Tetris here, make sure to fill in that lower-right corner!
Wow, really?! I wonder how HaCkl managed to break a million... All the other scores on here are in the 200K area, which seems more feasible...

While building, don't forget to deal with the goombas, either by squishing them with the tetrominos, or by switching over to Mario mode and jumping on them. Note that the already-placed blocks aren't considered solid by the Goombas or Mario, and they can pass through them freely.
It's time for more bridge-building segments.

The Mario and Tetris scores are tallied separately, but they all contribute to the same grand total. Also, not dying at all helps your score a bit, too. I don't think there is a time bonus, but correct me if I'm wrong on that.
Squish!
Note that any piece that lands completely outside of the outline will just shatter, and won't ruin your chance at the perfect castle bonus, so you can use that fact to discard unwanted pieces.
Lucky!
Now I just need that blasted line piece. Hopefully it'll show up before I'm forced to hit the flag...
Also, these blocks can be used by Mario as steps, and Mario can also hit the blocks that I place if they're positioned properly.
I probably should've used that line piece elsewhere. Oh, and the game gives you a decent opportunity to get a Tetris here. You just have to do some setting up first.
Yay, level complete! Wait, where's the castle?

Uh, oh. Better not forget about Mario down there. We wouldn't want him squished against the left edge of the screen by the autoscroll now! Press space to switch back to SMB mode so you can take control of him again.
Unfortunately, for some reason, I can't run or duck. That's odd... Also, why are bricks only worth 5 points instead of 50?

Well, I'm in third place for the day that I recorded this. I may decide to upload a video of me scoring much higher than I did here in the future. I have already broken 100K, but is 200K within my reach? Find out next time! ...Maybe.
Well, better give myself another ? block so I can get another mushroom.
We're approaching a vast expanse now, so I've gotta build bridges for Mario to cross with.
So, now we're playing Tetris with SMB blocks. That's cool. And look, you can even clear lines with them if you make unbroken horizontal rows that span the width of one of those background stripes.
Also, you can herd them into a small "pen" and squash them all at once later! Mwahaha!
Yes! And that's game!
Yeah, forget that entrance. The auto-scroll won't wait. However, there is an easier way down there.
Okay, that looks good for the moment.
Clear this fairly easy to clear line to open up the room below.
Okay, now I just need a square and a J...
However, if you fill in the castle outline completely without leaving any gaps or letting any bricks fade out outside the outline, you'll get a nice bonus added to your score.
